subject: Brett the Jet
event:
That shout you all heard last week was me, reacting to the news that Brett Favre had been traded to the Jets.

Yes, he's old.  Yes, he can drive you crazy with that now-I'm-retired, now-I'm-not stuff.  But he's still Brett Favre.  This year should be a lot more exciting in the AFC East.

Could this be the year I get my Subway Superbowl?  

Well, probably not.  But a boy can dream.

(I am sorry to lose Chad Pennington.  Chad's taken a lot of crap from fair-weather fans, but he was a smart, tough, gutsy guy who played his heart out, and when healthy, one of the best quarterbacks in the league.  All those injuries took their toll, sad to say, but I will always cherish the memory of his first year, and that 41-0 playoff win over the Colts.  I hated to see him go to the Dolphins, he's too dangerous a competitor to have in the division, but I will always wish him well... at least when he's not playing the Jets).

props.current_music: When You're a Jet, You're a Jet All the Way

comments.article: i have been taking some heat for it, but i am delighted to get Favre. i am so glad to not be the only one thrilled to bits by this!

>_<

I totally root Jets just for you, but dude, HOW can you be exicted about Favre?
He's liable to need hip replacement half way through the season!!!
I do want to see him lead the Jets in a win over the Packers, just because I HATE the Packers, that would rock!

It's back to the odd year, even year theory.

Last year I said I'd be shocked if they won more than five games, and true to form, they won four.

This year, I predict 10 wins and a wild card slot.

Favre just helps =D

As a Pats fan (I know,..I know, but if it helps I pay hardcover price for all of your books!) I'm psyched to see both Favre and Pennington twice each, this season. Who knows? We might see one of them more than twice!

I knew you would be pleased.

It pains me.

I hate that y'all gave him the number 4 jersey though.

comments.upictitle: Xray Is As Xray Does: howler monkey
comments.article: I wonder how long the honeymoon will last, and who will start the carping first -- the Post or the Daily News?
Probably the News.

You probably don't remember this, but we talked for a few minutes about football at a Mysterious Galaxy signing in San Diego a few years back. I was wearing a Chargers hat, the whole Eli Manning saga had just happened, so we ended up chatting about "young Eli" (as you called him), much to the dismay of the fans behind me who were probably aghast that their favorite author was discussing sports.
Anyway, I lived in NY for 8 years, when Chad was QB -- it was *very* exciting when he just started, Chrebet was still sort-of active, and there was another young WR... was that Santana Moss, before he became a Redskin? Anyway, yes, it'll be fun to see Pennington play again - just hope he stays healthy.
Id like to see the Jets get a shot in the arm, they deserve some good luck. I would however NOT like to see the Giants in the Superbowl.

Chad Pennington has had a whole list of issues, he's been injury prone. His arm strength has been questionable over the years. His ability to be a mobile quarterback has been happened over the years. He also sometimes makes throws which are questionable, and most of his career has benefited from very talented receivers. See from college career playing wish Marshall (Randy Moss) onwards through the hot as hell Santana Moss and Laveranues Cole
As soon as I heard the news I was keeping an eye out for your thoughts on the subject. I wish all my favorite authors cared about football. If they were Redskins fans, so much the better!

I wish you cared about aDwD and aSoIaF this much. :(

Seriously, I regret having started the series almost as much as I regret having recommended it to friends of mine. As it is, I'm hooked and will of course snatch it up the moment it (hopefully) hits the shelves, so, congratulations I guess.

Do you feel any sense of obligation at all to your fans, or is it more a matter of 'sit down, shut up and be thankful if I decide to do anything at all'?

Does it bother you that you've alienated many of your fans by your lackluster commitment to your own creation?
Oh, quit yer bitchin'.

Not a week into practice and his arm's already "fatigued." With all due respect, you can have him. :p

And unfortunately no Subway Superbowl this year. The Big Game's in Tampa and my boys are going to have home-field advantage. W00t!
comments.subject: Buc girl here...

comments.article: All I gotta say is Beware The Madden Curse! =)

I shake my fist in your general direction!

Madisonian here (we actually met briefly at the pewter place when you were here for OddCon! Thanks for the Shadows in Summer rec, btw...), and half my friends are in mourning.

At least it was you guys, and not the Vikings...
I wish it had been the Bears.. but Favre is Favre and while I love my Packers, I can root for him even if he is playing for the Jets...
I was sick of Favre about three weeks ago and am extremely displeased that he's now in my neck of the woods.  Especially since I love Chad to pieces.  Gah.

I love your books... but i'm a raider fan.

dont have arya kill me
comments.subject: Ummm so yeah...

comments.article:
In other news....Jets go bankrupt after massive increase in zimmer frame budget.

:p

I love watching Favre play, but this whole saga's just been.....ugh.

As a life long Packer fan I am still smarting from the whole ugliness.  I wish Favre the best and will still be pulling for him to succeed, excepting when he would play against Green Bay (which at least for this year would not happen except in the Superbowl, which is highly unlikely but would be a very interesting situation if it did come to pass).
Watching all you Cheeseheads implode would be fascinating, if that were to happen.

LOL you know my boyfriend who is from New York said a few weeks back something about this whole mess to me I who am a Wisconsin born Packers fan that was rather amusing. "My family doesn't understand what all the hype is about so I told them it's kinda like the Pope telling the Catholic Church he wants to retire then coming back and saying never mind I think I'd rather just be Jewish."

Being a die hard Packers fan, that is for the team specifically I am of the mindset that if you were a true team player you wouldn't push so hard to leave the team. Some say it is the mentality of a lover scorned but truth is I never much liked the man. He is an ego maniac and I think we will have a better team now that the ego from hell has left the building. I'm just glad he wasn't traded within the Division. The less I see of that man right now the better.

You know I have only in the last year gotten over Holmgren leaving! I was raised to worship at the alter of Lombardi as a child and praise our Savior almighty Brett of Favre. Frankly this is all just weird. Kinda like making a PB&J sammich only to find the PB is soy and the J is mint julip.

Pennington to Miami, is it? So out of touch here on the other side of the Atlantic. I don't know ... I don't expect much of anything from Miami this season, alas. My poor 'fins.

If they can do decently against the Jets, maybe even take the lead at some point, I'll be happy enough I suppose.

As a Dolphins fan, I have to say that it hurts me not the least to see my Phins get the windfall from this Farve signing. After last year, there's no way that I can start making any bold predictions, but I do know that this has all made the first game of the season a WHOLE LOT more interesting to me.

I look forward to a few back-and-forths on this sight after the 2 Jets-Dolphins games this year. Who knows? Maybe my Phish can win their first gaem somtime BEFORE the 15th week this year.

"For every yard Ricky Williams runs from scrimmage, an angel gets its wings!"
comments.subject: Your loss...

comments.article: yep....Madden curse gets a chance to prove itself again!
I think Favre can do it, if anyone can.

I was hoping and praying he would go to the Bucs.

As a Saints fan, I would rather see Farve twice a year than Garcia considering the hell Garcia has been ripping us with the past two seasons.

Farve's gunslinger mentality is much easier to reconcile against than Garcia.

And damn the Bucs vs Packers game this season would have been freakin awesome to watch to boot!

But I can be happy to watch Fins vs Jets now...I love storylines like that!

And Farve vs Pats... Games I normally don't care much about are suddenly a lot more intriging.

```````````````````````````````````````````````````````````

Welcome back from your many travels. I hope you had a wonderful time away from your work and responsibilities. I wish I could put mine behind me as you can. I know you love football. Will you be writing before the season starts and you will be watching all the games?
